page.title: 10CLUBS - THE VILLAGE HALL
page.content:
In l98l a long awaited community project was realised with the opening of a new village hall. Much voluntary help in its construction by local residents meant the cost was kept as low as possible - Â£36,000.
The main hall (60' x 30') has a parquet floor and has been marked out for netball and badminton. There are two committee rooms and a kitchen. The Sea Angling Club is one of the well established and most active in the village and one room of the hall has the special facility of a deep trough for weighing fish. Other organisations include the Evergreens (an old folk's club) Yoga, Keep Fit, Badminton, Playgroup, Table Tennis and Bingo.
